verdict.summary: Go syntax error. Common causes: missing comma in multi-line args, brace on wrong line.

dead_ends.why_fails: gofmt can't fix syntax errors â€” it requires valid Go code
The issue is usually a specific missing token, not style

workarounds.action: In multi-line function calls/slices, add trailing comma on last element
workarounds.how:
f(
  arg1,
  arg2,  // trailing comma required
)

workarounds.action: Opening brace { must be on the same line as if/for/func in Go
workarounds.how:
func main() {  // correct
// func main()\n{  // WRONG

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'syntax error: unexpected ...' indicates a Go parser error (missing brace, wrong token, etc.), while 'import cycle not allowed' indicates a circular dependency between Go packages.
'syntax error: unexpected ...' indicates a Go parser error caught at compile time, while 'WARNING: DATA RACE' indicates a runtime concurrency issue detected by the Go race detector.
